Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of 17 β-Estradiol in Postmenopausal Women Undergoing Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: A total of 174 postmenopausal women were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Participants were recruited from a single cardiac surgery center.

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either 17 β-estradiol or placebo

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the impact of perioperative 17 β-estradiol on neurocognitive dysfunction and quality of life

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was neurocognitive dysfunction, assessed using a standard psychometric battery at baseline, 4 to 6 weeks, and 6 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 174 postmenopausal women were randomly assigned

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of the 174 participants, 108 completed the study (54 in each group).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Thirteen percent exhibited neurocognitive dysfunction postoperatively.
